alert.note: Alert for Adams; Clay; Fillmore; Hall; Hamilton; Howard; Merrick; Polk; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 12:59AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clay, northeastern Adams, western York, Hamilton, northern Fillmore, Merrick, southwestern Polk, southeastern Howard and Hall Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1258 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of St. Libory to near Giltner to near Clay Center. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Phillips around 105 AM CDT. Saronville around 110 AM CDT. Aurora and Sutton around 115 AM CDT. Palmer and Marquette around 120 AM CDT. Hampton, Grafton and Archer around 125 AM CDT. Central City, Fairmont, McCool Junction, Bradshaw and Lushton around 130 AM CDT. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 302 and 354. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Clay; Fillmore; Hall; Hamilton; Howard; Merrick; Polk; York
